## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

#Ejercicio 8

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(plyr)  
library(Rmisc)
library(plotrix)
data("faithful")
head(faithful)
```

```{r}
#Media
tiempo_prom_esp<-mean(faithful$waiting)
err_es_mean<-std.error(faithful$waiting)
interv_conf<-CI(faithful$waiting, ci=0.90)
```

```{r}
#Mediana
mediana_tiempo_esp<-median(faithful$waiting)
err_es_median<-1.253* sd(faithful$waiting)/sqrt(length(faithful$waiting))
```

#Ejercicio 9

```{r}
data("quakes")
head(quakes)
```

```{r}
data <- quakes$mag
eps <- sqrt(1/(2*length(data)) * log(2/0.05))
plot(sort(data), ecdf(data)(sort(data)), type = "S")
abline(h = 1, lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 2)
rug(sort(data), ticksize=0.02, col = "blue")
lines(sort(data),ecdf(data)(sort(data)) - eps, col = "red", type = "S")
lines(sort(data),ecdf(data)(sort(data)) + eps, col = "red", type = "S")
```

#Ejercicio 10

```{r}
normal<-rnorm(100,0,1)
epsi <- sqrt(1/(2*length(normal)) * log(2/0.05))
plot(sort(normal), ecdf(normal)(sort(normal)), type = "S")
abline(h = 1, lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 2)
rug(sort(normal), ticksize=0.02, col = "blue")
lines(sort(normal),ecdf(normal)(sort(normal)) - epsi, col = "red", type = "S")
lines(sort(normal),ecdf(normal)(sort(normal)) + epsi, col = "red", type = "S")
```
